Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: htckr
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the hotel during New Year time for four nights. Hotel is pricy-for-value like most of the other hotels in Singapore. Hotel meets your expectations if you dare to venture to a more authentic surroundings in which local people work and eat, in this case in the outskirts of Little India. Rooms are small and very basic, and well, a bit out-of-date: ours smelled of cigarette smoke (our friends room didn't), but bed linens were clean. Staff is polite and can help you with normal touristy questions. Wifi signal was weak in our room. Breakfast gets you going with toast, some fruits and scrambled eggs, but for anything more you should really visit the hawker food court just across the street offering a great selection of Asian food around the clock, at a very affordable prices. Hotel location is a bit distant from the popular tourist attractions, but there's a bus stop beside hawker court with several buses taking you downtown. There are three MRT stations within walking distance but not very close: Farrer Park (through the mall) was maybe the closest, Boon Keng the easiest to travel to/from and Lavender an option if you prefer EW line.

Reviews.Title: “Room for three people is too tiny”
Reviews.Author: I_am_a_passanger
Reviews.Content: The room for three people we got was very small. We had no space to put our laggage. We had a view to a wall. The shower was ok with hot water. On the very first day we had a visitor: a cockroach. So we hadc to close all our staff for the night and each time we left the hotel. The breakfast is very basis but ok. The neighbourhood is good to visit Little India, not far away from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: danielbochi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very simple, but it is clean and with good staff. The room size is good enough, the bathroom is also good, the AC works good. The road is a little bit noisy, then if you can, prefer to stay in the rooms located in the back. The location is not good, it is quite far from the MTR, about 3km. The breakfast is simple as the hotel, bread, butter, jam, coffee and banana, the products are good but you don't have many options. If you don't want to spend much money you can stay at Madras Eminence, but don't expect much from it. As I said the cost-benefit is very good, believe me. For the price they charge the hotel is good enough, i would say fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Just great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: enainggo
Reviews.Content: We ran out of options, and found this hotel. Staff was very friendly, TOTO the dog was awesome. Def. a PLUS to the hotel, which entertained my tow kids even my wife!!! :O Hotel was clean, wifi, elevator, near bus stations and friendly staffs. Breakfas was good... healthy and clean! Nice ... Would come back with No Doubt! PS: The bar accross the road can be a bit Noisy! Sign police, do something!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected... EXcellent service”
Reviews.Author: MAZLahore
Reviews.Content: After a detailed research on different sites, reading reviews, comparing costs, short listing the options with connecting rooms and breakfast, the reason for selecting Madras Hotel was the reviews of people about their staff's friendly and helping attitude. Even the negative feedback about hotel was with the appreciation for staff. And when we checked in on early morning of 14th June 2011 it was all proved to be true. We arrived at 0730 in morning and our rooms were ready to our surprise. Even they offered breakfast for that day which we were not entitled at all so we availed the same. Extra pillows, blankets were no issue. Rooms were small but we only spent nights there so no problem. A complaint about Washroom was addressed immediately even it was around mid-night. The cute "To To" ( pet dog of one of the staff) soon became friend of my children. Breakfast was very limited and simple (Toast, Jam, Butter. one fruit and tea/coffee with stumbled egg), searls but what we could expect in this cost (199 SD for two inter-connected rooms with five Beds 2 washrooms)? We stayed six nights there and the staff helped us in transportation options very effectively. We used MRT, Taxi, Buses every means of transport. The girl at receptionist was so affectionate to my kids. one of my kids got a minor injury and the boy at reception (CHOA was his name I believe) immediately provided first Aid box and I managed the dressing followed by repeated dressing every day using the First Aid Box free of charge). Over all it was a pleasant experience and we will love to stay there again. PS. We also used their laundry machines for just S$ 8 (Wash and dry).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with basic facilties”
Reviews.Author: shrikanth_hegde
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in this Hotel and had no big issues. Room was small and basic but clean and well maintained. Reception staff was very friendly and provided some good information about how to reach some tourist attractions. Breakfast was only limited bread, eggs and banana. WiFi internet was offered free but was very slow for first 2 days. They also provide a Ethernet cable and there is a network point in the room and this was little faster. Location is close to Lavender MRT station amking it easy to use public trabsport

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation. Clean and Safe yet affordable!”
Reviews.Author: thundercloud0514
Reviews.Content: I was for months looking for a budget hotel that could fit 5 persons in one room. I had so much doubt at this hotel at first. But because where we are travelling on a budget, I booked it. When we arrived at the hotel, room for 5 is taken so they gave us connecting room, a double and a triple room at no extra cost! We were so happy bout it cause now we have two bathrooms! LOVE: Connecting rooms Location is across a hawker station Beds are great! Room is greats! Great sleep! Breakfast is included in the cheap rate! Can make local calls without extra charge HATE: Honestly, none! Except that if your allergic to pets, the owner have a beautiful dog and cat which som might not want

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: StephandAlan60s
Reviews.Content: The Madras Hotel Eminence is a short walk away from noisy Little India so it is quiet at night. The bus stops opposite so it's easy to get into the city. The underground is only a few minutes walk away. The staff are helpful, the free breakfast quite adequate , and the free internet each day is also welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: oyyo
Reviews.Content: Good location in the center, few minutes walk from lil india. the rooms are samall, quite old, but it s clean, with private bathroom, and for a reasonable price which is good to say, especially in SG. The staff is really helpfull. Moreover, you just have to cross the street and you have a 24/24 asian foodcourt, with amazing wanton noddles

Reviews.Title: “Functional but small room and nasty carpet”
Reviews.Author: vvontour
Reviews.Content: Small room, dirty carpet but overall it was totally functional. We were surprised at the cost (usd100), but this seems to be normal for Singapore. Reasonable distance to mrt but felt safe walking late at night (there were 2 of us). Staff were good.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: balagopalks
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the internet, we decided to try this hotel.The hotel was very small like kind of a turn around home, yet the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very light but sufficient. The staff were very friendly,gave it kind of a homely feeling. The disturbing thing was the sound of music played in the nearby Club(if your room is near road side) and its a little far from the nearest MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly Recommended for my kababayan PInoys”
Reviews.Author: cherryadventurer
Reviews.Content: Our family love animals. We saw the loving dog, nice cat and a trained dog. This is a cheap and yet family friendly hotel. The clean rooms are carpeted, with tv,, split type aircon and heated shower. They have complimentary water too. They have free breakfast and wifi. Across is the lavender square which is open 24 hours. We love all the food there-it is so yummy. There is also 7 eleven nearby. The place is a walk away from the lavender mrt. Grocery, computer shops, massage, disco bar, bus stops are nearby. We met Filipinos who were also checked in the hotel. There is a Filipino employee. The person in the reception is very accommodating in terms of directions on how to go to different places. One thing a tourist must remember in taking the taxi to go here is to tell to bring to MAdras hotel emminent -jalan baesar near lavender food square and eminent plaza. There are 2 madras hotel. The one in tekka and emminent.

Reviews.Title: “A good find!”
Reviews.Author: DuncanFam
Reviews.Content: Our family was stranded in Singapore during the volcanic ash disruption and we found it very difficult to find any available accom. We eventually found this hotel on a web site and managed to book two rooms. We arrived before lunch and both rooms were ready for us (they provided us with connecting rooms with no problems unlike some other Singapore hotels) Both rooms were clean, had new A/C unit which was very quiet and had new beds. They were cleaned well each day and bottles of water supplied. We had 3 very good nights sleep in this hotel with no noise. The staff were so helpful and friendly with everything we asked for and we got 15 mins free INTERNET each day. There is also a launderette area which was reasonable to use and a life saver for us! Breakfast is basic in a very basic room but was included in the price and was fine. All in all we had a nice stay here and liked staying in Little India-a great experience which contrasts to the chic, up -market areas of Singapore. Glad we did it!

Reviews.Title: “What else do you need..!!”
Reviews.Author: Inder_bis
Reviews.Content: You never really know what you're gonna get, even looking at places online :) Well, to my surprise it was pretty nice. Mine was air conditioned room with a TV and a toilet. Plus it came with free breakfast and free Internet. No Complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: santosh_bond
Reviews.Content: First of all I would give the hotel staff an Excellent rating! I was travelling with my family where i had my father who had health restrictions.. The hotel staff were communicating with me very promptly both via emails and chat and patiently answered all my questions. They even made arrangements for an early check-in. The rooms were decent and clean. We booked 2 rooms for 5 people. The TV was small and cute, never seen such a tv! :) They provided us with a very basic free breakfast which was decent with scrambled eggs, toast and bananas. The only problem we faced was that the MRT (train station) was little far for my father.

Reviews.Title: “Straight from the heart”
Reviews.Author: ChennaiAppu
Reviews.Content: My wife,adult son & I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were not charged for early check-in at 0830 and the reception staff were very friendly and kind. Free wi-fi was very useful to stay in touch with friends and the location of the hotel was excellent and the cleanliness was spotless. I will stay in the hotel any time I will go to Singapore and I will gladly receommend this hotel to all my friends from India. Kudos to hotel management for running the hotel so nicely. A mini-fridge in the room will be a welcome addition V.LAKSHMI NARASIMHAN \, CHENNAI, INDIA

HotelInfo.Name: Madras Hotel Eminence
HotelInfo.Address: 407 Jalan Besar, Singapore, Singapore
